data.title: Guide for dataset contribution

milestone.title: WIKI completion
milestone.description: There is a lot of work to have a complete wiki. All the wiki's ToDos are attached to this single milestone.

data.body:
I'll add some reference on what i think is missing for the assets contribution page.
- Specifies if a parameter is optional or not.
- Specifies what a param is needed for ?

https://github.com/methusalah/OpenRTS/wiki/Guide-for-dataset-contribution#unit
-  <MoverLink value="GroundProne"/> -> GroundProne is a define value or arbritrary ?

https://github.com/methusalah/OpenRTS/wiki/Guide-for-dataset-contribution#actor
https://github.com/methusalah/OpenRTS/wiki/Guide-for-dataset-contribution#mover
- these should be done since they seam to be required by the unit and projectile

As example of another way to present information (be kind i don't fully understand what each value is) : 
# Unit

```
<Unit id="tank">
    <UIName value="simple combat armored vehicle"/>
    <Race value="human"/>
    <Radius value="0.8"/>
    <Speed value="4"/>
    <Mass value="1"/>
    <MaxHealth value="120"/>
    <MoverLink value="GroundProne"/>
    <WeaponList WeaponLink="TankCanon" TurretLink="TankTurret"/>
    <WeaponList WeaponLink="TankMachinegun" TurretLink="TankMachinegun"/>
    <WeaponList WeaponLink="TankFrontLaser"/>
    <ActorLink value="Tank"/>
</Unit>
```

Required value : 
- MoverLink (see # Mover)
- ActorLink (see # Actor)
- MaxHealth (Maximum amount of health the unit have)
- Radius (Collision size of the unit)
- Mass (Acceleration and inertia...) (as side note i don't understand the inertia think, deceleration ?)
- Speed (How many meter does the unit move by sec (m/s))

Optional value : 
- WeaponList (one or many) (see # Weapon)
- UIName (Description name to use)
- Race (...idn...)

About the WeaponList the current one is kinda tricky, i think that it should be renamed WeaponLink and work like all other value, this give us :
-  WeaponLink value="TankCanon"
-  WeaponLink value="TankMachinegun"
-  WeaponLink value="TankFrontLaser"

Then the turret value would be stored inside the Weapon himself as : 
# Weapon

```
<Weapon id="TankCanon".>
    <UIName value="ubber powerful canon"/> (I don't think this is needed)
    <EffectLink value="StdDamage"/>
    <Range value="5"/>
    <ScanRange value="7"/>
    <Period value="1.2"/>
    <ActorLink value="TankCanonMainActor"/>
    <SourceBone value="BMuzzle01"/>
    <DirectionBone value="BMuzzleVec01"/>
    <TurretLink value="TankTurret"/>
 </Weapon>
```

Required value : 
- EffectLink (see # Effect)
- ActorLink (see # Actor)
- SourceBone (projectile source)
- DirectionBone (projectile direction)
- Range (How far the weapon can shoot)
- Period (Delay between two attack)
- ScanRange (how far the unit start moving to get in range)

Optional value : 
- TurretLink (Is this weapon a turret)
- UIName (Description name to use)

data.title: Unit position update on map editing
data.body:
While adding a cliff or increasing the terrain height where an unit is, the unit goes underground.

Expected behaviors : 
- [low] Delete the units.
- [advance] Having the unit position updated to follow the new height.

Ps : My first issue /o/

These models will need skeletons to create a wind effect. Why not animations.

thx

data.title: Contributors Inn : Present yourself !
data.body:
This special issue is for us all ! Here we can present ourselves to learn more about all the contributors and other OpenRTS enthusiastics.

Don't be shy !

data.title: support for buildings
data.body: In a crafting RTS Building are not like units. Normally they are not moving but if exists there have some special features. For example buildings extend the tech-tree or in buildings you can build some units.

data.title: Architecture Question
data.body:
Hi,

what are the idea and the tasks of the following classes: 
model.Commander.java
model.Model.java
model.Reporter.java
model.ReportEventListener.java
I need more background to understand it right. Until now, it looks a little bit confusing.
Thx.

data.title: networking support
data.body:
I created a branch named "networking" in my own repository for that. 
First step should be, is to create a server client architecture with onboard JME networking (see http://wiki.jmonkeyengine.org/doku.php/jme3:advanced:networking ). The client logged into the server and create events of all needed thing. The server only reports the events. 
In next step, another second client can connect to the server. The clients are "talking" (with events) to each other to synchronize your games.

data.title: Hauteur maximale dans la classe HeightTool
data.body:
N'ayant vu aucune sécurité sur la hauteur maximale du terrain avec l'outil height, j'en ai rajouté une.
Ma méthode est de définir une constante nommée MAX_HEIGHT et de tester si la hauteur est supérieure a cette constante, si oui, alors elle y est égale. 
EDIT : personnellement, j'ai mis MAX_HEIGHT a 50

data.title: Lower default resolution
data.body: I changed it for myself in the main file, but I think it would be nice if it was possible to try out the game on typical laptop screen resolutions like 1366x786 without having to dive into the code.

data.title: Artstyle and back-ground story of the sample game
data.body:
Even though the main purpose of OpenRTS seems to be a general RTS engine, good software development practice suggests that this is developed while implementing a practical example.
I like the current idea to have a simple and very stylized art-style... a bit like what the game "Planetary Annihilation" is also doing. At the very least it allows rapid art creation, especially when the units are mainly non-humanoid and thus only require simple animations like a turret or some particle effects.

For the overall style and background I was thinking about expanding the existing art set towards a post-apocalyptic snowball-earth scenario that should go well with the more or less untextured low-poly art. 
The first faction would be then rather low tech tanks "diesel-punk" that the surviving population uses. The other faction could be aliens that invade the "empty" planet and try to terraform pockets on earth (with strange plants and fungi etc.). A third faction could be returning "high-tech" terrans that left shortly before the catastrophe to live in generation ships, but have now returned to "safe" the home-world from the alien invasion (and are not really welcome be the local humans either).

Focus would be competitive multiplayer and maybe SP/coop scenarios to play against an AI.

As you can see it is a bit of a Starcraft like scenario, that requires a snowy base level style, an alien terraform plant style, and maybe an orbital platform style for creating the various levels.

I am willing to work on the 3D art assets, but I will probably need some help as I don't have that much time. Therefore keeping the art requirements low is key to success I think.

data.title: general framework software architecture
data.body: Hi all, OpenRTS should be a framework which supports any kind of common real-time strategy gameplay, design and control. With the current features (watch the engine in action !) OpenRTS has the potential the crow up to a powerful game engine. But we need a concept for extending and changing the generic functions of OpenRTS. We cant implement all wishes of all developers, which want to use OpenRTs. On the other hand, we must extend OpenRTS to support some new features like sound, networking and so on. The software-architecture must be prepared for this. In our last project we have very good experience with an EntityComponentSystem. Here are some explanations: http://wiki.jmonkeyengine.org/doku.php/jme3:contributions:entitysystem:introduction or http://wiki.jmonkeyengine.org/doku.php/jme3:contributions:entitysystem:advanced This software architecture means a big refactoring, but solves a lot a problems which will coming in later versions of OpenRTS like multiheritance in models, codecomplexity in the controllers and extending/overriding functions in game implementations. Any opinion on that? Are there any other plans for the future? thanks.

data.title: Ramp type selection only possible in cliff menu
data.body:
The usage of the ramp tool is a bit confusing as there isn't an option to change the ramp type, it just follows the cliff type selected.

Thus I would suggest to either include the ramp tool in the cliff section or allow the selection of the ramp type in the ramp menu.

data.title: Turn speed of units, make slower?
data.body: Right now the turn-speed of the units seems nearly instant, which makes the game look... hmm can't think of the proper term... cheap? Of course it should not be too slow either, to not let it seem unresponsive... something in between ;) Thanks!

data.title: Guide for asset contributions (Models, Units, sounds, GUI, maps)
data.body: Would be nice to have some more details in the wiki how to expand the game asset-wise, especially how to contribute models, configure unit xmls, make maps, improve the GUI, contribute sound effects and music etc.

data.title: Guide to project setup for asset contributors
data.body:
Would be nice to expand the wiki a bit to explain in simple terms how to set up the jMonkeySDK for assets contributions.

If I get some pointers to try it myself, I can do the write-up in the wiki.

data.title: support for JME Application States
data.body:
Hi,

why you don't use JME's Application States? (see here
http://wiki.jmonkeyengine.org/doku.php/jme3:advanced:application_states )
It's looking that you implement the same thing in your class controller.Controller.  Things like enabled/running/paused/updateLoop are implemented manually by you. Is there a reason for that?

Is it because you use a timer-speed-combination? And than you must handle you own Updateloop?
thanks for answering

data.title: Tools must compute their increment according to the elapsed time since last frame
data.body: Otherwise, the tool will apply differently on different size of map or different computers with different performances, which is not the target behavior.

data.title: [Optimization] compress the atlas
data.body:
The atlas may be compressed to take less place and be written faster on the hard drive. This will espacially be necessary when the map will have to be bigger. 

An idea : for each pixel, it is rare to have more than 2 or 3 layer that ar not null. We can store only non null values for each layer.

Other idea : one layer can be rebuild with the value of other, because the sum is always 256.

data.title: Tiles can be stored as a wide String
data.body: save and load would become fasert, and file smaller
